required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Master Protocol to Assess the Safety and Antitumor Activity of Genetically Engineered T Cells in NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-1a Positive Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Master Protocol to Assess the Safety and Antitumor Activity of Genetically Engineered NY-ESO-1-Specific (c259) T Cells, Alone or in Combination With Other Agents, in HLA-A2+ Participants With NY-ESO-1 and/or LAGE-1a Positive Solid Tumors (IGNYTE-ESO)

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will evaluate safety and efficacy of GSK3377794 in patients with solid tumors, initially in patients with synovial sarcoma.

detailed_description.textblock: Adoptive T-cell therapy (ACT) is a therapeutic approach that uses T lymphocytes of patients with cancer, obtained by leukapheresis, with the aim of generating an anti-tumor T-cell immune response. New York esophageal antigen-1 (NY-ESO-1) and LAGE-1a antigens are tumor-associated proteins that have been found in several tumor types. Clinical trials using adoptively transferred T-cells directed against NY-ESO-1/LAGE-1a have shown objective responses. GSK3377794 is the first generation of NY-ESO-1 specific T-cell receptor engineered T-cells. This is a master protocol that will initially consist of two substudies, investigating GSK3377794 in previously untreated patients with advanced metastatic synovial sarcoma (Substudy 1) and in patients with advanced metastatic synovial sarcoma who have progressed following treatment with anthracycline-based chemotherapy (Substudy 2).

study_design_info.masking_description: This will be an open-label study. Hence, there will be no masking.

primary_outcome.description: Overall response rate is defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) relative to the total number of patients within the analysis population at any time as assessed by Investigators per Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version (v) 1.1.

Overall response rate is defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed CR or PR relative to the total number of patients within the analysis population at any time as assessed by central independent review per RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Time to response
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response is the time from the date of T-cell infusion to initial date of confirmed response (PR or CR) as assessed by Investigators per RECIST v1.1 in the subset of patients who achieved a confirmed PR or CR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Duration of response
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response is defined as, in the subset of patients who show a confirmed CR or PR as assessed by Investigators per RECIST v1.1, the time from first documented evidence of CR or PR until the first documented sign of disease progression or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Disease control rate
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate is defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed CR, PR, or stable disease (SD) with minimal 12 weeks duration relative to the total number of patients within the analysis population at the time of primary analysis as determined by Investigators per RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Progression free survival
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival is defined as the time from the date of T-cell infusion until the earliest date of radiological progression of disease (PD) as assessed by the Investigator per RECIST v1.1, or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Number of patients with adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study patient, temporally associated with the use of a study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent disability/incapacity is a congenital anomaly/birth defect or any other situation as per Medical or scientific judgment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Severity and duration of adverse events of special interest (AESIs)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the AESIs as a criteria of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Number of patients with replication competent lentivirus (RCL)
secondary_outcome.description: RCL exposure will be assessed by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) based assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Number of patients with insertional oncogenesis
secondary_outcome.description: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) samples will be collected for monitoring insertional oncogenesis by PCR for gene modified cells in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: platelets
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: hematocrit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: hemoglobin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: Red blood cell (RBC) count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: White blood cell (WBC) count
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Alkaline Phosphatase, Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), and Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Total and Direct bilirubin, Creatinine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and until disease progression (up to 5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in urine parameters: potential of hydrogen (pH)
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected for analysis of urine parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: Change from Baseline in urine parameters: glucose, protein, blood, bilirubin
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected for analysis of urine parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 1: T Cell Persistence of GSK3377794
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for T Cell Persistence analysis of GSK3377794 transduced cell quantities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Time to response
secondary_outcome.description: Time to response is the time from the date of T-cell infusion to initial date of confirmed response (PR or CR) as assessed by independent central review per RECIST v1.1 in the subset of patients who achieved a confirmed PR or CR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Duration of response
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response is defined as, in the subset of patients who show a confirmed CR or PR as assessed by independent central review per RECIST v1.1, the time from first documented evidence of CR or PR until the first documented sign of disease progression or death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Disease control rate
secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate is defined as the percentage of patients with a confirmed CR, PR, or SD with minimal 12 weeks duration relative to the total number of patients within the analysis population at the time of primary analysis as determined by independent central review per RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Progression free survival
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival is defined as the time from the date of T-cell infusion until the earliest date of radiological PD as assessed by the independent central review per RECIST v1.1, or death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Overall survival
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the interval of time between the date of T-cell infusion and the date of death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Number of patients with AEs and SAEs
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study patient, temporally associated with the use of a study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention. SAE is any untoward medical occurrence that, at any dose results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent disability/incapacity is a congenital anomaly/birth defect or any other situation as per Medical or scientific judgment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Severity and duration of adverse events of special interest (AESIs)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess the AESIs as a criteria of safety.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Number of patients with RCL
secondary_outcome.description: RCL exposure will be assessed by PCR based assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Number of patients with insertional oncogenesis
secondary_outcome.description: PBMC samples will be collected for monitoring insertional oncogenesis by PCR for gene modified cells in the blood.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Number of patients with positive anti-drug antibodies (ADA) against GSK3377794
secondary_outcome.description: Serum samples will be collected up to 36 months for ADA test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Titers of ADA against GSK3377794
secondary_outcome.description: Serum samples will be collected to analyze for the presence of ADAs using validated immunoassays.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: platelets
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: hematocrit
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: hemoglobin
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: Red blood cell (RBC) count
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in hematology parameters: White blood cell (WBC) count
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of hematology parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Alkaline Phosphatase, Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), and Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Blood Urea Nitrogen (BUN)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in clinical chemistry parameters: Total and Direct bilirubin, Creatinine
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for analysis of clinical chemistry parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in urine parameters: potential of hydrogen (pH)
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected for analysis of urine parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: Change from Baseline in urine parameters: glucose, protein, blood, bilirubin
secondary_outcome.description: Urine samples will be collected for analysis of urine parameters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Substudy 2: T Cell Persistence of GSK3377794
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected for T Cell Persistence analysis of GSK3377794 transduced cell quantities.

arm_group.description: After screening, eligible patients will enter a leukapheresis phase. Patients with previously untreated advanced metastatic synovial sarcoma will receive GSK3377794, administered as a single intravenous (IV) infusion.

After screening, eligible patients will enter a leukapheresis phase. Patients with advanced metastatic synovial sarcoma who have progressed following treatment with anthracycline-based chemotherapy will receive GSK3377794, administered as a single IV infusion.

intervention.description: GSK3377794 as a single IV infusion.
Fludarabine will be used as the lymphodepleting chemotherapy via IV administration.
Cyclophosphamide will be used as the lymphodepleting chemotherapy via IV administration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must be >=10 years of age at the time of signing the informed consent.
- Patient has a diagnosis of synovial sarcoma confirmed by histology.
- Patient has advanced (metastatic or unresectable) synovial sarcoma.
- In substudy 1, patient with metastatic synovial sarcoma who is newly diagnosed or previously untreated.
- In substudy 2, at the time of treatment, patient has received/completed treatment with anthracycline or anthracycline with ifosfamide for advanced (metastatic or inoperable) disease and progressed.
- Male or female. Contraception requirements will apply at the time of leukapheresis and treatment.
- Patient must be positive for Human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-A*02:01, HLA-A*02:05, and/or HLA-A*02:06 alleles by a validated test in a designated central laboratory.
- Patients tumor has been pathologically reviewed by a designated central laboratory with confirmed positive NY-ESO-1 expression.
- Performance status: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group of 0-1.
- Patient must have adequate organ function and blood cell counts 7 days prior to leukapheresis.
- Female patients of childbearing potential must have a negative urine or serum pregnancy test.
- Patient has measurable disease according to RECIST v1.1.
- Supportive radiotherapy has not affected >25 percent of bone marrow.
Exclusion Criteria:
- In substudy 1, patient has been previously treated for metastatic synovial sarcoma.
- Central nervous system metastases.
- Any other prior malignancy that is not in complete remission.
- Previous treatment with genetically engineered NY-ESO-1-specific T cells.
- Previous NY-ESO-1 vaccine or NY-ESO-1 targeting antibody.
- Prior gene therapy using an integrating vector.
- Previous allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplant.
- Clinically significant systemic illness: serious active infections or significant cardiac, pulmonary, hepatic or other organ dysfunction, that in the judgment of the Investigator would compromise the Patient 's ability to tolerate protocol therapy or significantly increase the risk of complications, or, prior or active demyelinating disease.
- Patient has history of chronic or recurrent (within the last year prior to leukapheresis) severe autoimmune or immune mediated disease requiring steroids or other immunosuppressive treatments.
- Uncontrolled intercurrent illness.
- Current active liver or biliary disease.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding females (due to risk to fetus or newborn).
- Prior/concomitant therapy: any prior treatment-related toxicities must be Common terminology criteria for adverse events <=Grade 1 at the time of initiating study intervention (except for non-clinically significant toxicities).
- Other standard of care lines of therapy are allowed only if guidelines and washout periods are followed.
- Patient has active infection as defined in the protocol.
- Patient has known psychiatric or substance abuse disorders that would interfere with cooperating with the requirements of the study.
- Patient had major surgery <=28 days of first dose of study intervention.

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD for this study will be made available via the Clinical Study Data Request site.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: IPD will be made available within 6 months of publishing the results of the primary endpoints of the study.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access is provided after a research proposal is submitted and has received approval from the Independent Review Panel and after a Data Sharing Agreement is in place. Access is provided for an initial period of 12 months but an extension can be granted, when justified, for up to another 12 months.
